dublin_core.dcvalue: We demonstrate the use of a camera phone as a low cost optical detector for quantitative analysis of a high sensitivity C reactive protein hs CRP enzyme linked immunosorbent assay ELISA The camera phone was used to acquire images of the ELISA carried out in a conventional 96 well plate Colorimetric analysis of the images was used to determine a standard curve that exhibited excellent agreement with a fitted 4 parameter logistic model R 0 998 The limit of detection LOD for this approach was determined to be 0 026 0 002 g ml 1 035 0 079 M CRP Furthermore these results were found to be in very close agreement with measurements obtained for the same assay using a laboratory based instrument These findings indicate the basic technology to enable low cost quantitative home based monitoring of an important clinical biomarker of inflammatory disease may already be present in the patient s home
IEEE transactions on biomedical circuits and systems
Camera phone-based quantitative analysis of C-reactive protein ELISA.
